name: Dark Souls: Collector's Edition
storyline: Dark Souls employs minimalist storytelling to convey its plot and lore. Historical events in its world and their significance are often implicit or left to player interpretation rather than being fully shown or explained. Most of the story is given to the player through dialogue from non-player characters within the game, flavor text from items, and world design.
summary: Dark Souls: Collector's Edition is a special edition of the action role-playing game Dark Souls, developed by FromSoftware and published by Bandai Namco Entertainment. Released in October 2011, this edition includes the full base game and a range of exclusive bonuses. It comes in a special collector's box featuring unique artwork and includes a physical art book with concept art, character designs, and illustrations from the game. The edition also provides access to behind-the-scenes videos, including developer interviews and making-of content. Additionally, it features the official game soundtrack, composed by Motoi Sakuraba, and a mini-strategy guide to assist players in navigating the game's challenging world
